msgSnippet: Chandrashekhar, You could try MTUnit, ref: http://www.mousepushers.com/java.html#mtjunit Hope that helps, -Kamal. ... From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
Chandrashekhar,

You could try MTUnit, ref: http://www.mousepushers.com/java.html#mtjunit

Hope that helps,
-Kamal.

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
chandrashekhartm
Sent: Friday, May 19, 2006 10:09 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] how to write run method in testcase?


Hi! All,

im getting follwing problem,
when im trying to implement following code. . . . .

public class basicTest extends AbstractTestCase implements Runnable{

......
.
}
the AbstractTestCase extends the TestCase class..

The error show in eclipse is:
" The return type is incompatible with Runnable.run(), TestCase.run
()"
i know 'TestCase' class contains run() method, and 'Runnable'
interface contains run() method.

i don't know how junit supports mutithreading?

Thanks in advance
chandrashekhar
